intro: Notholaena marantae subsp. cupripaleacea, commonly known as the red-stemmed nettle fern, is a member of the Marantaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red stems and lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by three-winged fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and tropical garden settings.
